natural solution: When using the distributive property for the first time, we add the product of $2x+3$ and $x$ to the product of $2x+3$ and 5: \begin{align} (2x+3)(x+5) &= (2x+3) \cdot x + (2x+3) \cdot 5\\ &= x(2x+3) + 5(2x+3)
\end{align}We use the distributive property again and combine like terms: \begin{align} x(2x+3) + 5(2x+3) &= 2x^2 + 3x + 10x+ 15\\ &= \boxed{2x^2 + 13x + 15} \end{align}
